result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony Leland Bivins Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 2 days time served.
Huber privileges for work, school and treatrment. NOT eligible for Day Repoerting Center or electronic monitoring.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony Leland Bivins Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Anthony Leland Bivins in court with attorney Stephen A Sargent.  Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Court sentenced defendant to serve 60 days in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 2 days served; Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment.   Not eligible for Day Reporting Center or electronic monitoring.  Costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge due within 1 year of release from custody or a civil judgment shall be entered.  Appeal rights given.

Defendant waived rights and pled GUILTY.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.   Court ordered case adjourned for Sentencing in Branch 26.  COURT WILL RETAIN FILE.

Defendant Anthony Leland Bivins in court with attorney Stephen A Sargent.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for Paul Hauer for the State of Wisconsin. 
On motion of the State Court AMENDED Count 1 from Bail Jumping - Felony  TO  Obstructing/Resisting an Officer under Wisconsin Stats. 946.41(1), and 939.51(3)(a) a Class A Misdemeanor.   Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Parties are prepared to proceed with a Projected Guilty Plea.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony Leland Bivins in court with attorney Stephen A Sargent.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Scheduling conference scheduled for 05-07-2014 at 09:00 am.
Defendant Anthony Leland Bivins in court with attorney Stephen A Sargent.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony Leland Bivins in court with attorney Louis Epps for Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  
Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.
14RM015515  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff: 03-19-2014

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Anthony Leland Bivins in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Anthony Leland Bivins in custody.  Joanne L. Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 27, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
